metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7637 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) through 1.2.15 and 2.x through 2.0.9 has a heap-based buffer overflow in SDL_FillRect in video/SDL_surface.c. USN-4143-1 addressed serveral vulnerabilities in SDL 2.0. This update provides the corresponding fixes for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7637` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl1.2debian - 1.2.15+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

libsdl2-2.0-0 - 2.0.4+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.16.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: emitorino> Patch causes regressions for some applications/games: https://bugzilla.novell.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1124825

criterions.comment: libsdl1.2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.15+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1').
libsdl2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.4+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.16.04.2').
